title: High school swim team members shaken but safe after plane overshoots runway
text:
A twin-engine Alaska Airlines flight from Anchorage to Unalaska Island overshot the runway and stopped just short of plunging into the waters of Unalaska Bay Thursday evening.

At least four people were injured, according to reports -- but members of a high school swim team aboard the flight were said to be OK following the harrowing incident.

Alaska Airlines Flight 3296, operated by Peninsula Airways, ran off the runway while landing at Alaska's Unalaska/Dutch Harbor Airport, airline officials said in a statement.

Ryan Burnias

The plane, a Saab 2000 turboprop, had three crew members and 39 passengers aboard, including members of the swim team at Alaska's Cordova High School.

"At present, all students and chaperones are accounted for and are OK, albeit a bit shaken up," read a statement posted by superintendent Alex Russin on the school district's website Thursday night.

The statement said that "the team was together, seemed fine, and were eating pizza."

At least four people were taken to the hospital by ambulance, according to Unalaska TV station KUCB, which reported that three people were conscious and sitting upright, with at least one holding an ice pack.

Ryan Burnias

Interim Police Chief John Lucking said there were no casualties, KUCB reported.

Photos taken afterward showed the plane resting at about at 30-degree angle on a rocky embankment, with its nose just feet from the water.

Unalaska Island is part of the Aleutian Island chain to the west of the Alaskan mainland.
description: A twin-engine Alaska Airlines flight from Anchorage to Unalaska Island overshot the runway and stopped just short of plunging into the waters of Unalaska Bay.
